body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky Your Petitioner John StClair would most respectfully state that at the last February term of the Marion Circuit Court Ky a judgement was rendered in favour of the Commonwealth of Ky against Your Petitioner for five hundred dollars and costs for the alledged offense of dealing faro -- Your Petitioner frankly admits that during the last Summer in Lebanon Ky while a large crowd was congregated in said town being assembled here in consequence of the draft and with a view to supply substitutes procure exemptions &C while so in said term a number of his friends & acquaintances were at his room at the Harris house and while there & wanting Some amusement requested that Your Petitioner would deal a little for their amusement and he did so Your Petitioner does not make his living by dealing faro He is poor and totally unable to pay the fine -- Nor has he any relatives or friends that can or will do so for him -- Therefore he will be compelled to lay in the Jail of Marion County Ky unless your Excellency interposes & remits the fine for which your Petitioner prays --
Sworn to before me by John St Clair This April 14th 1865
T. TC. Jackson Clk, M, C, C
The undersigned join in the prayer of Petitioner John St Clair for a remission of the fine

J. R. Thomas
T. C. Jackson
B. Spalding
D. W. Phillip

Marion Cir Ct
vs
John St Clair Petition
Remitted
24th April/65
